A single universal language could facilitate global communication and understanding, leading to greater cooperation and collaboration among nations. It could also reduce misunderstandings and conflicts that arise from language barriers.
A single universal language could help to promote cultural exchange and understanding, as people from different countries would be able to share ideas and experiences more easily.
A single universal language could simplify international business transactions, as companies would not need to deal with multiple languages and currencies.
A single universal language could help to promote global education, as students would be able to learn and communicate with each other more easily, regardless of their native language.
A single universal language could help to promote global tourism, as visitors would be able to communicate more easily with locals and navigate foreign environments more easily.
